column1: yorker - or a near yorker - on off stump, he jams his bat down and keeps it out. Right on the money is Gabriel
good length, angled in on off stump, Noor Ali is half-forward as he defends into the covers
good length, again, but this holds its line outside off, carefully angled down to deep third man for one. Noor Ali and Afghanistan off the mark
Gabriel shortens his length. This one starts outside off and seams back in sharply, Ahmadi is surprised. The ball zips past the inside edge. Hope flies to his left to stop the ball
jumps from a back of a length outside off, the batsman rises with it and fends it wide of backward point

overpitched and outside off, Noor Ali simply leans into it and caresses a drive through the covers. The outfield is slow but the ball outruns the chasing fielder. The boundary spoils what could have been an excellent over
back of a length, Holder uses his height and generates extra bounce outside off, no shot
starts outside off and swerves away further, off-side wide

back of a length and angled in, clipped straight to midwicket. Noor Ali sets off for a single, there is a silly, old mix-up. Lewis swoops down on the ball, but can't nail the stumps down. A direct hit could have sent the non-striker packing

fuller than a good length, beats the flick, deflects off the pad and rolls away to square leg. Lewis moves to his right and swoops down on the ball again. Excellent dive and pick-up, and this time he throws the stumps down at the striker's end now - all in one motion. Spectacular effort from Lewis. Ahmadi dishes out a full-length dive, and that just saves him. The TV umpire looks at various angles and rightly gives it not out
re-set the radar, another off-side wide
just short of a good length, denies him swinging room, chopped out to point
jumps onto a top short ball outside off and flays it straight to backward point
pitched up and outside off, firmly driven off the front foot, extra cover flings himself to intercept the ball
full and outside off, defended onto the pitch
short and wide outside off, Ahmadi stands on leg stump and reaches out for the ball with hard hands. The ball whistles past his reckless slash
banged in short and outside off, blocked to cover, with the head right over the ball. Much better
and again! Back to slashing is Ahmadi. Gabriel teases him with a back of a length ball outside off - not really short for the cut. Beats the swinging bat again
Ahmadi just can't resist. Pitched up and wide outside off, draws a loose away-from-the-body drive, edged between slip and gully. That would have carried to second slip - if he was there
length ball outside off, no shot now
good length and very close to a wide outside off, Holder gets away with it, left alone
good length and outside off, leaps off the surface, Ahmadi loves bat on ball, beaten again. Loose
back of a length and wide outside off, ignored
wide of the crease, but this length ball holds its line outside off, left alone again
wide of the crease, again, this is angled into the thigh, diverted to square leg
Holder ventures wide of the crease, angles it down leg, leg-side wide now. Holder has bowled both sides of the wicket
too straight in line, helped wide of long leg, a weak throw ensures Afghanistan take two off the extra ball
fullish and outside off, run away to point
excellent ball from Gabriel. Back of a length outside off, extra bounce, splice-jarring length. Ahmadi does equally well to loosen his grip and fend it off to cover point
flashed in the air to the right of a diving extra cover. Floated full and outside off - half-volley - driven on the up, flies past Lewis. First real bad ball from Gabriel
another rising short ball outside off, hops, skips, and fends to point

Has he gloved it behind to the keeper? The umpire shakes his head.  Pops off the right forearm to the keeper. Hurled in short, angled in, the batsman was late to sway away and drop his bat. Good call from the umpire
short and slanted a long way down leg, left alone. Hope flies to his left and saves four for his side
full and outside off, drives early, drives on the up, but does not carry to short cover
Holder hangs it up very wide outside off, tempts the batsman into a drive, he resists. That was past the guideline. Umpire Shamsuddin does not deem it a wide. He was tempted, though
full on a sixth-stump line outside off, no shot
good length and outside off, left alone again
fuller than a good length and angled in the corridor, no shot again
wide of the crease, back of a length and angled in, no shot again. Five dots in a row
ends an over of leaves. No bat on ball. West Indies playing with Afghanistan's patience or the lack of it
short, angled in, chest-high ball, swivels on the back foot and hooks it to long leg. Chase chases to his left from square-ish long leg and swats the ball in before collecting it
just short of a good length and outside off, dabbed to the right of gully with soft hands
left alone outside off
short and angled in on off, slams the splice, and rolls down to gully. Gabriel running in hard, hitting the deck harder
tight line on off, pushed into the covers again
hurled short and outside off, rides the bounce and plays it to backward point

The pressure tells on Noor Ali. He had not put bat on ball against Holder in the last over. He could have evaded this. Instead, he lobs a return catch. This was a top ball, though. Banged in short and aimed at the head, the batsman looks away, taking his eyes off the ball. He has a half-fend, half-hook, or something in between, and chips it back to Holder
banged in short and angled in, draws another leading edge, this does not carry to backward point
short and really wide outside off, past the guideline, another off-side wide
back of a length on a fifth-stump line outside off, no shot
back of a length and angled in on off, hops and fends it to mid-on
length and in the corridor, left alone again

Is this a repeat of Miller-Du Plessis? Looks just as ugly! Both batsmen are at the striker's end. Lewis hunts the ball down and throws it to Holder, the bowler, who tips the bails off at his end. This was on a back of a length and angled in, tucking up Rahmat for room. He taps it to the left of short midwicket. There is an awful mix-up between the wickets, and Ahmadi is the one who is short at the striker's end. What an over for WI! Two wickets
short and outside off, aims a forcing cut and chops it behind to slip
short and angled in on the leg stump, cramps the batsman up for room, half-fended and half-hooked to long leg
rapid bouncer on leg stump, ducks under it
splice-jarring short ball, kicks up on off, Gabriel keeps hitting the deck hard. Fended onto the pitch
Bounced out! Gabriel bangs in another short ball on the stumps, head-hunting lifter, harries him for pace. His response is a weak, top-edged pull. Square leg comes in and settles under the skier
hurled in short again, attempts the hook, miscued in front of square leg now
wide of the crease, angled in, picked off the hips to long leg, just a single
overpitched and outside off, he capitalises on it, and simply drills it through the line, mid-off (Chase) dives to his right, replays suggest he just dived over the ball. A rare boundary
back of a length and angled in grazes the thigh and rolls away to square leg
short and angled into the hips, cramps him for room, the ball lobs in front of square leg
short and angled in on off, he puts his bat up like shield and saves himself from being hit

glances the helmet and balloons over the keeper? Given as runs. Might have been a top edge. Dug in short and quick on off, no room to play the hook and he is also late onto the shot. He gets away with it, though

big appeal for lbw! Given out. But reckon the angle would have taken it down the leg side. Shenwari has to depart, though. Full and angled in sharply from over the wicket, Shenwari is pinned to the crease, he plays all around his front pad. But this would have missed leg. No DRS in this series
short and angled in, gets inside the line and helps it wide of long leg for a couple
ginger run-up, short and angled in on off, still hits the bat hard. Fended back to the bowler
dragged short on off, hurries the batsman for pace, and raps the glove as the ball drops to the leg side. Big front-foot no-ball
bouncer outside off, flies off the deck, flies over the hook. Another front-foot no-ball
floated full and outside off, opens the face and bunts the ball to point
short and attached with loads of width outside off, carved away to the right of deep third man
lifter outside off, rocks his head out of the way
short and angled in on the stumps, fended to leg
wide of the crease, holds its line outside off, sneaks under the big cut. That did not get up at all
back of a length and outside off, sits back and pushes the ball to the cover-point region
short of a length and angled in on off from wide of the crease, barely rises up to the chest, clipped away to square leg
leg-side short ball, he aims a flick, gloves it fine past the keeper
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, tucked away to long leg
bouncer, angling in and gets up to a testing neck height, but just outside off stump and Nabi can sway away fairly comfortably
once again digs it in short. This time Nabi shuffles across and works it off his ribcage into the leg side
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended to midwicket
shortish, doesn't really get up high enough for the pull. It's about stump-high, on off stump, and Stanikzai drags it towards square leg, all along the ground
shortish, rising over off stump, gets on his toes and defends into the point region
flat on off stump, not much turn, goes back to punch to long-on
a bit of flight now, outside off, gets a big stretch out to defend back to the bowler
goes back to a length ball on off stump, works it into the square leg region
shortish, spins in towards off stump, punched back to the bowler
slower now, full on middle stump, clipped through square leg
shortish, a touch of width, and that's well fielded by backward point diving to his right. Made room and cut that quite firmly
goes back and across to a length ball on a fourth-stump line, defends into the covers
shortish, close to off stump. Big step back and across from Nabi. Looks to play into the on side with the angle, closes his bat face, the ball pops off the leading edge towards point
short again, this one's wider outside off, opens his bat face and slices it uppishly over Nurse at short third man

that's a proper, nasty bouncer, and Stanikzai can't do much about it at all. I'm not sure too many batsmen in international cricket could, to be fair. Fast, rising to head height, and angling in towards the badge of the helmet. The pace, especially the pace off the pitch, left Stanikzai with no time to move across, sway, or duck. He just stood there, flung his hands up to protect his head, and popped it high and loopy to the keeper off the gloves
full outside off, driven to backward point
the short ball again, goes wider of the crease and slants it in. Ducks hurriedly and it passes over Zazai's back
back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers
similar length and line - in terms of where it pitched - but this didn't turn. Looks to cut and misses
straighter and quicker, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers
tossed up fuller and wider, stretches out to defend into the off side

ooh, sharp chance. Not really a drop, because Holder didn't get a hand to it. He was at slip, and he took a step to his right when he saw Nabi shaping to punch this back-of-a-length ball outside off. The ball went very quickly to his left off a thick outside edge - no turn again - and he stuck his hand out but too late
bouncer close to off stump, Nabi sways his upper body away from the line
back of a length, close on off stump, defended into the point region
another testing short ball, another wicket. This one angles in and gets up towards Nabi's left ribcage. He just fends awkwardly at it and fends a loopy, simple catch to midwicket running to his left

oh man. Naib was expecting the short ball even before Joseph delivered. Backed away from leg stump and ducked, and this ended up as a length ball that just about bounced over off stump, maybe a few inches wide of it
this one is short, but outside off, left alone fairly comfortably
this really isn't the greatest of starts from Gulbadin. Length ball, fourth-stump channel, and he clears his front leg and slogs and fails to connect
slower yorker, right at the batsman's feet. Nice change-up given how nervous Gulbadin's looking. He keeps his eye on this one, though, gets his front leg out of the way and defends
dangerous, from Zazai. Gets forward and across to a ball pitching on middle and off, and nearly gets his pad in the way of his flick towards short fine leg

nicely bowled. He's been getting a bit of drift away from the right-handers, and he floats this up slow and wide of off. Pokes at it, plays the initial line, and gets a thick outside edge that rolls away past slip
back of a length, straighter, goes back to punch to midwicket
quickish length ball on off and middle, stays back to defend to midwicket
back of a length, wider outside off, this is the one that goes with the arm. Watches it well and defends towards point
quickish length ball on middle stump, defends towards midwicket
ooh, good ball. Lovely length outside off, invites the drive without quite pitching full enough for it, and the ball zips past the outside edge
shortish, rising to hip height over off stump. Gets a little opened up but defends reasonably comfortably down into the pitch
another sharply rising ball, over off stump. Goes back and across to defend, hits high on the bat and pops in the air but well short of the fielder at cover
bouncer, angling a touch down leg. Steps across and lifts his bat over his head to make sure he doesn't get a touch on it
shortish in the corridor, goes back and across and plays that well, nice and late, with soft hands into the point region
ooh, good ball. Again Zazai plants that front foot across. This one's a length ball angling in towards off stump. Defended into the on side
back of a length on off stump, gets nicely behind it to defend back to the bowler
back of a length, turning in towards leg stump, worked to midwicket
full, close to off stump, presses forward to block back to the bowler
slower, wider, gets a good stride out, waits, and defends into the cover point region
floats this up a lot wider outside off, driven to sweeper cover
full outside off, defended into the covers
short, fairly wide. Goes on with the arm, though, and beats the cut. He'd made himself room, and the lack of turn meant he ended up too far from the ball to connect
short ball, as expected, outside off. Made room and shaped to uppercut, but decided in the end to leave it instead
bam. This time, instead of backing away from leg stump, he takes a premeditated step back and across towards off stump. Gets a full ball just outside off stump, and slogs it away crisply over mid-on
bouncer now, as expected. Gets his front leg well away from leg stump and leaves it
back of a length, angling into middle stump from wide of the crease. Stays leg-side of the ball and blocks into the covers
slower length ball outside off, lets it come on and punches to mid-off
short ball outside off, pulls and doesn't quite middle it. Hits the outside half of the bat and floats up into the big gap at deep midwicket
full outside off, defended into the short extra-cover region, the bowler does the fielding
a bit more flight outside off, driven to long-off
nice flight and a bit of drift just outside off, good stride forward to defend
slower now, gets a stride forward and then realises this is dipping shorter than expected. Waits and defends with soft hands
shortish outside off, not enough width to cut and it stops on him too. Drags it back to the bowler instead
goes back to a length ball outside off, ends up beaten by lack of turn while trying to defend
shortish, rising over off stump, lets it come on and defends into the point region
back of a length, angling down leg, Zazai misses the glance
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defended towards point
back of a length, angling towards leg stump. Misses the flick and deflects off the edge of his thigh pad. Hope dives left to prevent leg byes
short ball outside off, left alone. Loopy bounce through to Hope
bouncer over off stump, ducks low to avoid it
bouncer, angles down leg again. Zazai ducks to evade it
short ball over off stump, jumps back and across and defends into the on side
tossed up close to off stump, defended into the covers
slower and fuller, whipped to long-on
flat length ball on off stump, no turn. Good ball, watches it well and clips through midwicket
floats it up slower and wider, driven away to the left of sweeper cover. Beat backward point diving to his right
flighted length ball outside off, defended into the point region
fuller, angled into off stump, defended into the midwicket region
full on middle stump, clipped through square leg
fullish outside off, stretches out to block into the covers
fuller now, outside off, driven firmly to beat short extra-cover diving right, but mid-off mops up moving quickly to his left
length ball on middle and leg, shows a nice straight bat to push into the vacant wide mid-on region
back of a length outside off, left alone
fullish on off and middle, pushed down the ground to long-on
quickish length ball on off stump, goes on the back foot to clip to square leg
tossed up outside off, defended back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched to long-off
back of a length close to off stump, goes back and across and defends to midwicket
back of a length, turns towards the pads, worked away through square leg
floated up full and wide of off, driven crisply but short cover dives right to intercept
back of a length outside off, tiny bit of nibble away. Goes  back to defend, rolls off the outside half of the bat to the left of backward point
shuffles out of his crease this time, premeditatedly. Ends up slogging too early across the line and missing a length ball outside off
back of a length outside off, nips in a touch, defended off the back foot
full on leg stump, flicked to the left of Joseph at long leg. Moves quickly to keep it down to one
length ball angling into off stump, good stride forward to block to mid-off
length ball close to off stump, defended back to the bowler
flat, angling into middle and leg, clipped to backward square leg

got him, that's a lovely bit of bowling. Saw Zazai stepping out and bowled it wider outside off, made him stretch out to defend. A bit of drift away and no turn back in, and the thick outside edge goes to slip at waist height
flat, back of a length, just outside off, goes on the back foot, looks to whip into the leg side but the lack of turn forces him to play it more defensively and straighter than he'd like
length ball outside off, beats the outside edge of his defensive bat with lack of turn
flat, shorter, not short enough to cut, beaten again
tossed up slower outside off, presses forward to defend
full, angling into off stump, punched firmly to mid-off
bouncer over off and middle, gets into a low crouch to evade it
short again, angling down leg, Gulbadin misses the pull
ooh, short again and this one rises up to shoulder height, just outside off. Looks to pull, and top-edges into the side of his helmet. Ricochets to the left of backward point
short again, outside off, left alone
back of a length, angling into off stump, tucked away into the backward square leg region
slower ball, fullish outside off, defended to mid-off
short, a bit of width, punched away to the left of sweeper cover
flighted length ball close to off stump, blocked back to the bowler
short, wide, slapped to sweeper cover
fuller now, gets forward to whip it from outside off down to long-on
top-edged slog-sweep, the ball dipped on him a little, on an off-stump line, and the ball drops into the big vacant space between long-on and deep square leg
floated up wide of off, stretches out and defends into the cover point region
bouncer, angled down leg, the batsman evades it. Wide call. The short-ball barrage continues
just short of a good length and outside off, opens the face and steers it to point
shoulder-high short ball just a shade outside off, Rashid is late onto the hook and watches the ball sail past him to Hope
off-stump yorker, which is dug out to gully
wide of the crease, tennis-ball bouncer outside off, Rashid looks to upper-cut it to third man. No dice

more short-ball barrage. Dug in short on middle, chest-high ball, cramps the batsman for room. He hooks and top-edges it in the air. Joseph at long leg looks to settle under this skier. The ball, however, sails over him. Joseph tried to toss it back into the field of play. No dice. He lost his balance and tumbled behind the boundary. He seems to be in pain. Looks like he has done damage to his ankle
short and angling away outside off, from around the wicket, Rashid has a big leg-side slog at the ball and only edges it behind to the keeper. The finger goes up. Afghanistan eight down and sinking
tossed outside off, no turn, Naib sizes it up. It was right in the slot. Launched over the bowler's head
fuller and slower, blocked to the off side
dropped short and outside off, slapped away to sweeper
drops short of long-off running in. Tossed up outside off, skies a loft, it does not carry to Bishoo, who is subbing for Joseph. Good effort
tucked around the corner for one
short and wide outside off, goes deep in the crease and flat-bats it away to the right of sweeper
slower, full ball on off, Naib picks it and dares to take on the long-on fielder. Clears him. Clears his front leg and muscles it over the boundary
the batsman backs away outside leg, Holder follows him with a low full-toss, clipped away to long leg. Denies the single
bouncer outside off, tennis-ball bouncer, Naib drops his hands on it
slower full ball on off, quietly blocked to the leg side
rides the bounce of this short, wide ball and upper-cuts it past backward point, third man runs to his right and tidies up. Picks up a couple
'howzaaat' is the shout from Holder. This was pretty full and angled down leg from over the wicket. No bat involved. Brushed the pad en route to Hope
non-turner, back of a length and outside off, punched to cover on the back foot
tossed up and much fuller outside off, clears his front leg and swishes it over the top of extra cover, comfortably beats sweeper running to his right
fuller on the stumps, down the track and forced to long-on
flat dart on the leg stump, goes low and paddle-sweeps it fine of Gabriel at short fine leg. He gingerly chases the ball
hip-high short ball on middle and leg, steps back and pulls it away to long leg
skids on outside off, Naib forces the ball to cover and sets off. The fielder fumbles, allowing an easy run. So, Naib retains the strike
near yorker on middle, drags it to long-on off the toe end. Declines the single on offer
speared very full and very wide outside off, in fact well past the guideline
good length ball on off, brings his bat down in line and defends it to cover
back of a length on middle and leg, clipped away with the angle to deep square leg. Denies the single again, Naib doesn't want to expose the No. 10 to Gabriel
wide of the crease and slammed into the pads, fine leg was up, a little deflection would have benefitted Naib. However, it wasn't to be
length ball on middle, clears his front leg and hoicks it away to long-on
Zadran shuffles across off and puts the bowler off. Angled down leg, wide
near yorker - very full on off and middle - tucked away through backward square leg. Zadran sets off, Naib agrees to the single
length ball, slider on off, played back

Holes out to Lewis at deep midwicket. Lewis falls awkwardly on his right shoulder but clings on. Pushed through flatter and faster on middle, Zadran wants to slug it over midwicket. Dares to clear the long boundary. But Lewis runs across, dives, and completes an excellent catch
tossed full on off, defended back
swatted away to long-on
picked off the pads to square leg
full and outside off, driven through the line to long-off. Naib retains strike
short and angled in on middle, swivels and pulls to deep backward square
bouncer outside off, hooks and misses

full-toss, angled in on leg stump, tugged away to the right of wide long-on. Chase stretches his right hand as far as he can and knocks it towards deep midwicket. Mohammad pulls it back. Great tag-team effort. They save two runs
yorker, swerving into leg stump, beats him for pace and hits the boot, but this is clearly sliding past the leg stump
really full on middle, clubbed away to wide long-on. Takes the single and hands it over to Hamza
Gulbadin just crouches low at the non-striker's end. This is full on off, near yorker, capably squeezed through square leg
tossed full on off, hacked away to deep midwicket off the inside half. Naib farms the strike
hip-high short ball on the leg stump, he goes squarer now, pulls it with authority and finds the boundary. Naib raises his third ODI fifty
Naib pre-meditates, steps away outside leg, the bowler follows him with a flat, full ball, and cramps him for room. Naib looks to go big. But gets more height as opposed to distance. Finds long-off
full and slants in on middle and leg, picked away to the right of long leg
short and plenty of width outside off, Lewis just throws his bat at the ball and wildly slashes it over the top of slip
back of a length and angling across off stump, Lewis hoists his bat over his head and lets it go
shortish on middle, hangs back and works it just wide of mid-on
back of a length and angling across off, Powell is stapled to the crease as he opens the face a bit and runs the ball to point
dug in short on off, gets right behind in line and defends
angling into the hips, clipped away past square leg for one
jumps back to meet a short ball outside off, punched crisply between cover and point
skids on outside off, no turn, push-driven to mid-off
low arm, fired in from wide of the crease, inside-edged onto pad
shimmies out and clips to midwicket
tossed on off, another non-turner, played back to the bowler with soft hands
driven on the up, driven with great authority as Lewis bisects mid-off and cover. The length was right there - overpitched - and outside off. He pressed forward and nailed it
Zadran drags his length back just a shade outside off, played back to him
even shorter, proper bouncer, angling across off, Lewis lets it go
back of a length and angling across off, defended to cover
back of a length on middle, tip and run in front of mid-off. Smart calling and running
rapid short ball at the rib-cage, Lewis can't control a pull. Flaps it over square leg
down the track, meets a very full ball, whipped to long-on
darted down leg, wide
back of a length and outside off, stands up tall and punches a single to the right of deepish mid-off
Powell runs down the track, Nabi beats him in flight and hits the back pad. But this was mostly heading down with the angle from around the wicket
grip, turn and bounce, beats the nervous poke
short and angled in on off, back-foot force to long-on
tossed full on off, presses forward and pushes it back to the bowler
dug in short on off or just outside off, Powell picks the length up early. Swivels back and pulls it up and over midwicket
back of a length on the hips, neatly clipped through square leg
short and loads of width outside off, Lewis latches onto it. Scythes a cut over backward point. Flies to the boundary. Raw power
back of a length, angling away, seaming away, skirts past the groping bat. Lewis was lucky not to nick it off. Good riposte
fuller than a good length, swerving away, much closer to off, Lewis is stuck to the crease as he jabs and misses outside off
short and wide, can't bowl there to Lewis. This is a repeat of the third ball of this over. Cuts it on the up, smeared over backward point again
pushed down to long-on
angled in full on off, forward and dropped defensively to midwicket
dropped short and outside off, skips back and jabs it to mid-off
more round-arm than usual, clunked into the covers on the back foot
short and wide outside off, Lewis loves it there. Hangs back and flashes it between point and cover
half-tracker on leg stump, rocks back and pulls it only as far as deep square leg
full on off stump, pushed towards mid-off, who's deep enough to allow a single
back of a length on off stump, punched towards mid-off - a bit of turn and the ball rolled gently off the inner half of the bat, which made the single easier
googly pitching outside leg, looks to sweep and misses, hit on the pad
back of a length on middle stump, worked to deep square leg

and he's struck in his first over! Excellent googly, quick and fairly full, pitching on middle and off. Powell was a little late coming forward, and as a result had to push away from his body to meet the ball. Thick edge, deflected off the keeper's left pad to the fielder at slip

another googly, huge turn from outside off. Presses forward to defend without getting anywhere near the pitch of the ball, and he's beaten on the inside edge. Huge appeal for lbw, turned down. I think that spun too much, and would probably have missed leg stump
full on off stump, driven into the covers
tossed up, a bit of width, nice square-drive there, got his head right over the ball, but Rashid springs to his right from backward point to deny him any runs

ooh, nervy shot. Floated this up outside off and he clears his front leg to try and slog this away. No turn, and the slowness really made him reach for it. Beaten comfortably, and he nearly lifts his back foot as well
quicker and flatter on the stumps, worked into the square leg region
goes back to a length ball close to off stump, defends into the covers
back of a length outside off, punched to short extra-cover
back of a length, sharp googly, short enough for Hope to stay back, watch, and punch it back to the bowler

ooh, he doesn't know which way it's going to turn. This one goes straight on after pitching on a good length outside off. Plays for the googly, a nervous defensive prod, and ends up with his outside edge beaten
a touch short, drags a pull along the ground through square leg
nice stride forward, floated up across the left-hander, another googly, driven with an open face towards cover point
back of a length on off stump, makes himself room and chops to backward point
overpitched, a bit of width, and Lewis puts it away without a fuss, drives crisply between extra-cover and mid-off
length ball outside off, blocked into the covers
tossed up outside off, a bit of drift away, but he overpitches it and Hope drives smoothly to the right of the diving cover fielder
full on off stump, clipped to long-on
back of a length, goes straight on with the angle towards middle and off, punched back to the bowler
a touch short on off stump, chopped to backward point
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and shows the full face to push to long-on
quickish legbreak pitching on leg and turning down leg. Goes back to flick, and it rolls off the edge of his pad into the fine-leg region

back of a length, googly, a touch too straight, goes back and works it to deep square leg. Hope isn't looking up while running, and collides with Rashid on his way to the other end. Was pulling out of it at the end, but couldn't fully manage it
ooh, Lewis is lucky that pitched outside leg. Keeps really low as he goes back to defend, hits him on the pad

and guess what, he's done just that and sent back Lewis. Sensational bowling, and not very good batting against spin. Went back to a length ball, opened up a little, and his bat came down slightly across it in defence. The googly spun past his outside edge and hit his back pad, plumb in front
ooh, another superbly pitched googly. Outside off stump, and again he's playing back when he should be forward. Beats the outside edge of his defensive push
fuller now, a bit of flight, on the stumps, driven down to long-on
flat, round-arm, speared in towards off stump. Plays half-forward, looking to work it into the leg side, inside-edged into his pads
takes a step out of his crease this time, meets another flat, stump-to-stump ball close to the pitch and pushes down to long-on
tossed up outside off, nice stride forward to drive to the right of sweeper cover
full outside off, a bit quicker, brings his wrists into play to whip it firmly back to the bowler
flighted and full on leg stump, clipped into the square leg region
Carter comes down the pitch again and Nabi shortens his length slightly on off stump. Stretches out nicely to defend
back of a length outside off, punched back to the bowler
short outside off, long-hop, keeps slightly low, pulled to the right of long-on
full on middle and leg, flat and quick, gets his front leg out of the way and defends with the turn into the off side
googly, and he didn't pick this one. Just a touch short, turns in towards middle stump, and he adjusts late and brings his bat down hurriedly to whip to backward square leg
fuller, on the stumps, worked to the left of short leg, dives and stops it
quick and back of a length, uses his wrists, wants to play that to long-on, Rashid moves quickly to deny him the single
back of a length, angling down leg from wide of the crease. Can't connect with the flick, ball clips the thigh pad and falls a few inches short of the keeper diving right
length ball angling into off stump, defended back to the bowler

Naib strikes, and this isn't the greatest shot. Back of a length, angling in from wide of the crease, and that angle really cramps his attempted cut. A bit of extra bounce too, and the ball kisses glove through to Zazai
back of a length outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, left alone
again, back of a length, a little wider still, Mohammed leaves again, and that's a wicket maiden for Naib
full outside off, nice stretch out to defend into the off side
fullish on middle and leg, clipped down to long-on
back of a length outside off, defended into the covers
googly, pitching on that perfect length outside off. Mohammed presses forward softly, doesn't over-commit, and adjusts the position of his front foot to defend
another googly, this time he's slower getting forward, gets a thickish inside edge that bounces well short of short leg
another googly, slower this time, Mohammed gets a good stride in to defend back to the bowler
shortish, angling into off and middle, whipped away through backward square leg
back of a length on off stump, punched to short extra-cover
very full, fairly wide of off, left alone
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
short, a bit of width, punched away firmly and far enough to the right of deep point to pick up four. Beat cover diving left, and that was enough
back of a length on off stump, uses his wrists to clip towards mid-on
flat length ball, angling into middle stump. Stays back, and has to jam his bat down hurriedly to squeeze it out to backward square leg off the inner half of the bat
a bit more flight outside off, stretches out to stab to the right of point. Direct hit from Nabi at the keeper's end, but Hope was well home
full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
wide of the crease, slants a length ball into off stump, stays back and punches back to Hamza
length ball, a couple of inches outside off, goes back and punches into the cover point region
goes back to another flat length ball on off stump, punches back to the bowler
length ball outside off, stops on the batsman a bit as he looks to slap it square on the off side. Ends up dragging it back towards the bowler
short, a bit of width, punched to deep point
fuller now, on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
Naib gets another! This isn't great from West Indies. Now it's Mohammed's turn to get out playing the cut. The shot was on, but he didn't keep it down at all, and hit it straight to backward point
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length on middle stump, clipped towards midwicket, where Hamza dives right to postpone Chase's first ODI run
ooh, keeps low and doesn't miss off stump by much. He's been playing Hamza exclusively off the back foot, and this was a good-length ball. Sneaked past the inside edge of his punch
tossed up slower and wider, driven into the cover point region
full on off stump, driven to short extra-cover
full and flat on middle and off, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, slanting into middle and off, goes back to punch to midwicket
flighted on off stump and Chase is off the mark in this format with a drive down to long-off
length ball outside off, gets forward for the checked drive into the covers
full on off stump, driven to extra-cover
back of a length close to off stump, dabs it to the right of backward point and the fielder moves quickly to deny the single
short now, outside off, slapped to the left of deep point
back of a length close to off stump, goes back and pushes gently towards mid-on
length ball wide of off, slashes at it and slices it down to third man. A little dangerous, given that Naib has a fielder at a wide slip
googly, starts outside off, and breaks back into Chase, he does not pick it and plays down the wrong line. Rashid does not appeal - he knows that's heading down leg
regulation legbreak outside off, Chase loosely wafts at it and watches the ball beat the outside edge
flatter and faster on off, punchily defended back to the bowler
ripping googly, swerves in and skids on, keeps low as well, Chase somehow keeps it out on the back foot
bit more fight on off stump, fuller, driven with the bottom hand to long-on
oooh, Rashid skips past the outside edge again! This is the straighter one outside off, Hope searches for turn, when it's not there. Beaten. Another cracking over from Rashid
just short of a good length and outside off, crisply cut away to sweeper
back of a length and outside off, punched straight to mid-off
back of a length and angled in on middle, brings his wrists into play, whipping it in the gap between midwicket and mid-on
overpitched and outside off, stretches out and creams a drive straight to cover
re-set the radar, Naib. Floats it very full and wide outside off, nothing doing from Hope
back of a length and outside off, nicely punched away, extra cover throws himself to his left to stop the ball
wide of the crease, but this is the slower one on off, he plays a checked drive to cover
tossed up higher, really full on off, the batsman looks to drive, ends up bottom-edging it, nutmegging the keeper. They take two
perfectly-pitched googly, he picks it, nudges it with the turn to midwicket
another googly, this is short enough for Chase to hang back and punch it to the left of midwicket
dragged short and outside off, swatted away to long-on for one
faster googly, rips back in, Chase plays back and is pinned on the pad, but this is heading down leg
tossed-up legbreak outside off, Chase reads it, presses forward, meets the pitch and square-drives it past point
full and straight, plays around his front pad, flicking the ball away to square leg
very full and angled in, Hope shows the full face of the bat drives it smoothly to the left of mid-on. He did not over-hit the ball
back of a length and just outside off, angled out to point
shortish and outside off, guided to point again
very full and outside off, Chase shapes to drive, but does not get close enough to the pitch, squeezes an inside edge to mid-on

dug in short and angled in, Hope chooses to duck under it... but hangs it periscope up. Deflected fine over the keeper's head for a fortunate boundary, the first after 49 balls. The drink would taste sweeter for Hope and WI. They need a further 38 runs
another googly, starts outside off, breaks back in, and hits the pad. Heading down
follows the wrong'un with a skiddy straight ball outside off, Chase reaches out with his hands with his front foot nowhere near the pitch. Beaten
slides in with the angle from over the wicket, Chase plays around his front pad, but this is heading down leg as well
another googly, Chase plays back but keeps it out
another googly, but this is short enough for Chase to stay back and defend it back

follows the series of googlies with a regulation legbreak outside off. Drags Chase's back leg out of the crease. Zazai, the keeper, reacts swiftly, and takes the bails off. Chase's wicket raises Afghanistan's hopes. This was tossed up higher, Chase reaches out with his hands for a drive, loses his balance. The keeper does the rest
an appeal for lbw, but the umpire is moved. This is going down leg. Very full on middle and leg, angled in from over the wicket, plays all around it and is rapped on the pad
short and angled in on middle and leg, defended to square leg
back of a length and angled in, Powell gets right behind the line in defended. Played back
short and angled in on off, tip and run to cover point. The fielder swoops down on the ball but can't throw the stumps down at the striker's end. Powell gets off the mark, WI reach 100
full and angled in on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
Dawlat bangs it short and outside off, ducks under it, gets his bat down as well this time
full, non-turner on off, defended back to Rashid
quicker legbreak outside off, Powell simply tucks his bat inside the line and lets it go
another legbreak outside off, Rovman plays inside the line and is beaten past the outside edge now
googly now, Powell was expecting it, works it with the turn to square leg
straighter one outside off, ooh, Powell plays for the googly again, and is beaten again
tossed-up legbreak on off, stretches out and smothers it. Just one more over for Rashid
back of a length and angled in at off stump, defensively pushed to cover
shorter and angled in on off, jabbed to cover
short and outside off, jumps off his feet and slices a single to Rashid at deep third man
short of a length and outside off, punched on the up to swepeer
off-stump yorker, digs it out to cover
Slightly overpitched and outside off, Powell does not need any second invitations. He goes over the top, clearing mid-off. Crunching on-the-up drive
arm ball, on off, defended back
worked with the angle to midwicket
short and outside off, punched away to long-off
slower through the air and angled in, inside-edged onto the back pad
full, angled in, finds some turn, finds the outside edge but it does not carry to slip
full on the stumps, calmly pushed down to long-on
chest-high short ball on off, half-fended, and half-swatted to midwicket
even shorter on off, proper bouncer, Powell hooks late and watches the ball fly through to the keeper
another short ball on middle, fended to square leg
fourth short ball of the over, the line is wide outside off, Powell drops his gloves and lets it go
follows it with a slower one outside off, check-pushed to point
dug in short on off, hits the splice and rolls to cover
floated up on off, run away towards point
tossed up on off, defended back
full on off, keeps low, dead-batted
short and angled in on off, punched back
keeps it short on off, this is punched away to long-on for one
darted in on middle, back of a length, eased down to long-on
flighted on off stump, solidly driven down to long-on
full on off, guided towards backward point
straight ball on off, Powell bends forward in defence
slower offbreak on off, played with the spin to midwicket
a brief mix-up between the wickets but Powell undoes his steps in time. Clipped away to the right of midwicket. The fielder tumbles to stop the ball. Powell is rightly sent back
shortish and outside off, punched to point
attempted googly, short and into the hips, looks to pull but does not make contact
a bit too full on off, Powell gets under it and smokes a slog-sweep to the midwicket boundary
flatter and faster outside off, forced out to cover
short and speared down leg, looks like a wrong'un, off the thigh and rolls to short fine leg
short legbreak outside off, punched to the left of cover
tossed up very full and outside off, stretches forward and dead-bats it. Another grand spell from Rashid. He finishes with 42 dots and three wickets, but might not be enough to topple WI
slides on outside off, defended back to Nabi
too wide outside off to draw a shot from the batsman
full on the stumps, bunted down to long-on
grips in the surface and drifts away, defended back
tossed up on middle, this spins in, defended to leg
pushed through full on off, stretches out and plays it back to the bowler
darted in on leg stump, punched through square leg
full and angled in, nudged to short fine leg
slider, hurries onto the batsman, defended back
on a length and outside off, punchily driven to cover
full on off, opens the face and plays it to the left of the bowler
full on off, pushed to cover-point for one
slower through the air on off, calmly defended back
drops it short and wide outside off, slapped away on the back foot but sweeper tidies up
length ball, drifts away outside off, defended back
straighter one outside off, Powell hangs his bat out and is beaten past the outside edge
full on off, forward and pushed to mid-on
Powell goes for the glory strike and holes out to deep midwicket. Lots of flight outside off, goes low, and slog-sweeps it against the wind. Rahmat settles under the skier with WI 13 runs away
floated up on off, defended back
speared into the leg stump, hits the pad and rolls to short fine leg
full on the stumps, driven down to long-on
tickled with the angle to short fine leg
pitched up on off, defended to cover
back of a length and outside off, drilled to short extra cover, tumbling save from the fielder to his right
flighted and drifts away outside off, slices a drive through cover
Holder is eager to finish it off quickly. Flighted and drifts away outside off, down the track and sliced over extra cover now
skids on outside off, a big swish and a miss
stands tall to meet this short ball outside off, punched to cover, a misfield allows a single in the end
offbreak, ends up on the pads, clipped with the spin to midwicket
flat on middle and leg, punched down to long-on. Six off the over. Six more need for WI to square the series
full and angled in on leg stump, played back to the bowler
back of a length and attacking off, defended back again
full on the stumps again, tapped to long-on
skids on off, punched back to the left of the bowler
hint of width outside off, Holder flashes it to sweeper
overpitched and outside off, driven to sweeper for one more
short and angled in on middle, Hope hops and clips it to long leg
banged in short and outside off, Holder swings his hands at a big pull. The resultant top edge flies over the keeper's head. WI level the series 1-1
